intro: Silene fetleri, commonly known as the Turkish catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and parts of the Balkans. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Silene fetleri has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
